page.title: 04HOUSING IN ELMBRIDGE
page.content: The majority of houses in this rural area are spacious, detached and owner occupied. The few tennanted properities normally have agricultural connections and are more likely to be smaller and semi-detached. Some detached houses were originally two semis. Many houses have been modernised and extended. All houses have at least one bathroom. All houses have gardens, some extending to several acres. The buildings date from all periods, the earliest are timber framed, later brick was used. Modern properties are often bungalows. At least eight households have lived in the same house for over twenty years, one over fifty years, the majority for over ten years, six families have moved here within the last two years in each case they came from a Midlands industrial town.
